{"step_by_step_thinking": "The tongue develops from several structures. According to Document [2], the anterior two-thirds of the tongue forms from the tuberculum impar and the lateral lingual swellings, which are derived from the first pharyngeal arch. Document [7] states that the posterior third of the tongue develops from the hypobranchial eminence, which is a median swelling from the mesoderm of the second, third, and fourth pharyngeal arches. However, there is no mention of the arytenoid swellings contributing to the development of the tongue in any of the provided documents.", "answer_choice": "D. Arytenoid swellings"}
